content: Demon Internet was among the UK's first independent ISPs. It gained popularity in the early 1990s by offering affordable dial-up services and pioneered nationwide consumer internet. By 1995, it supported over 10,000 subscribers, accelerating public online adoption.

Established as the first commercial ISP in the UK, Pipex worked closely with academic networks like JANET. Known for bridging commercial and research internet, it opened up new possibilities for businesses by providing reliable domain hosting and email services.
